alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 19 at 10:26AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota...Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Lansing affecting Crawford, Houston, Vernon and Allamakee Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Lansing. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.8 feet, Water begins to cover Highway X52 by the wastewater treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.
